meanings.definition: A pair of eyeglasses with a handle, used for viewing objects at a distance.
meanings.sent1: She peered through her lorgnettes to see the stage clearly.
meanings.sent2: The opera enthusiast brought her lorgnettes to the show.
meanings.sent3: At the theater, everyone admired her elegant lorgnettes.
meanings.sent4: Her lorgnettes were like magic windows to the distant world.
meanings.sent5: The lorgnettes made the view seem closer and more detailed.

meanings.definition: A pair of eyeglasses with a handle, used for viewing objects up close.
meanings.sent1: He used his lorgnettes to inspect the tiny details of the painting.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler examined the gemstone with her lorgnettes.
meanings.sent3: She pretended her lorgnettes were magnifying glasses for fun.
meanings.sent4: His lorgnettes revealed the intricate patterns of the fabric.
meanings.sent5: With the lorgnettes, she could see every small imperfection.

meanings.definition: A pair of eyeglasses with a handle, used as a fashion accessory.
meanings.sent1: She wore her lorgnettes as a stylish addition to her outfit.
meanings.sent2: The fashion show featured models flaunting unique lorgnettes.
meanings.sent3: His lorgnettes matched perfectly with his retro attire.
meanings.sent4: The lorgnettes added a touch of sophistication to her look.
meanings.sent5: In the ballroom, the lorgnettes were the talk of the evening.
